instance Show Party where show p = "'" <> Text.unpack (unParty p) <> "'"

comments.body: Could you make the various `data` / `newtype` definitions in this file more visually uniform? I'm partial to the style used in here in `data Enum`, but consistency is more important than any particular preference anyway.

Yes! Totally Agree. I have recently migrated to the style used here for Enum. And have it on my to-do list to migrate this entire file to that format. But I didn't want to mix up a reformatting into this PR.

comments.body: We're using `Fixed E10` as the payload in the DAML-LF AST. See https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/blob/705f014a888e2854e6776458abe4484b2929dbc2/compiler/daml-lf-ast/src/DA/Daml/LF/Ast/Base.hs#L195 and https://www.stackage.org/haddock/lts-13.30/base-4.12.0.0/Data-Fixed.html
ok, I'll try this...

ok, changing to `Fixed E10` as you suggest
requires some changes to the raise/lower convert functions (as expected)
Good job I have round-tripping tests in place, or else I would have introduced a bug!

comments.body: I assume this field contains the name of the enum type. If so, we should use a better name, like `enumType`.

I was wondering if we could get rid of these fields entirely.
They are optional in the API.
When sending they can always be omitted
When receiving, they only get filled in in `verbose` mode.
I don't really see what purpose they serve.
They make the Ledger API nominally typed instead of "just" structurally typed. For example, they are good for sanity checking.

comments.body: Using `Int64` is a good idea. Most of the numbers we get here would not fit into an `Int32`.
Will `Int` ever realistically be `Int32` ?
The only guarantee the Haskell 2010 report gives is that `Int` has at least 30 bits. Since using `Int64` doesn't hurt, I'd prefer to do it.
ok

comments.body: The `show` instance for `Party` in DAML wraps the party name in single quote, eg. `'Alice'`. For the sake of consistency, we should do this here as well.
